title: Valance

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of top: cotton, plain weave; block printed; narrow band: silk, warp-float faced 5:1 satin weave with weft-float faced 1:2 's' twill interlacings of secondary binding warps and supplementary patterning wefts; upper and lower panels: silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, slit tapestry weave with interlaced outlining wefts; painted details; outer bands: silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, dovetailed tapestry weave; ribbon: silk, plain weave with supplementary patterning warps; outer edging: silk, warp-float faced 4:1 satin weave; lined with cotton, plain weave; painted inscription.

medium_display: Top: cotton, plain weave; block printed; narrow band: silk, warp-float faced 5:1 satin weave with weft-float faced 1:2 'S' twill interlacings of secondary binding warps and supplementary patterning wefts; upper and lower panels: silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, slit tapestry weave with interlaced outlining wefts; painted details; outer bands: silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, dovetailed tapestry weave; ribbon: silk, plain weave with supplementary patterning warps; outer edging: silk, warp-float faced 4:1 satin weave; lined with cotton, plain weave; painted inscription
inscriptions: Inscription translation (on reverse): Repair completed at the Yunlin Yuan in the eighth month of the fourth year of Jiaqing
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. William J. Calhoun through The Antiquarian Society
publication_history:
John E. Vollmer, "Clothed to Rule the Universe: Ming and Qing Dynasty Textiles at The Art Institute of Chicago," published in conjunction with the exhibition, Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies 26, no. 2 (2000): 39, 65, cat. 38, plate XX.

Elinor Pearlstein, "Color, Life, and Moment: Early Chicago Collectors of Chinese Textiles," published in conjunction with the exhibition, Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies 26, no. 2 (2000): 87, 109, note 24.

Ni Yibin, "The Iconographic Variations of Two Scenes from Romance of the Western Chamber" in Performing Images: Opera in Chinese Visual Culture, ed. Judith T. Zeitlin, exh. cat. (Chicago: Smart Museum of Art, The University of Chicago, 2014), 104-107 (ill.), cat. 6.18.
exhibition_history: Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Clothed to Rule the Universe: Ming and Qing Dynasty Textiles at The Art Institute of Chicago, Sept. 13, 2000–Jan. 2, 2001.
provenance_text: Mrs. William Calhoun [also Lucy Monroe Calhoun, 1865-1950], Chicago, by Jan. 29, 1927 [Pearlstein 2000; on loan to Art Institute of Chicago from Jan 29, 1927, loan number 134.1927, receipt R3190; copy in curatorial object file]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1937.
